name: NBA Playoffs: 2008 Trivia Game | NBA Playoffs | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who won the final's MVP Award in the 2008 NBA playoffs?
questions.explanation:
Paul Pierce.

	Paul Pierce in his first-ever NBA Finals appearance, led the Boston Celtics to the Championship against the LA Lakers (4-2), in their first visit there since 1987.

questions.text: Which player made the greatest impact along with Kobe Bryant for the Lakers in the 2008 postseason?
questions.explanation:
Pau Gasol.

	Ron Artest signed with the Lakers after that season while Bynum was injured, and Vujacic came off the bench for 5-10 minutes in each game. Pau Gasol was the leader in rebounds, blocks per game, and second in points per game behind Kobe Bryant for the Lakers.

questions.text: In the epic duel of the Eastern Conference semi-finals between the Celtics and the Cavaliers, in game 7 in Boston, Paul Pierce of the Celtics scored 41 points. How many did Lebron James of the Cleveland Cavaliers score?
questions.explanation:
45.

	The two players led their teams in scoring. The Celtics won game seven 89-85, and advanced to the Conference Finals to face the Detroit Pistons.

questions.text: On June 17, 2008, the Boston Celtics won their ___ NBA title.
questions.explanation:
17th.

	The last time they went to the finals prior was back in 1988 when they lost to the Lakers. The last time they won the championship was back in 1986 against the Houston Rockets.

questions.text: In 2008, the Atlanta Hawks led by Joe Johnson, Josh Smith, and Mike Bibby, returned to the playoffs after how many years of absence?
questions.explanation:
9.

	They fell in the first round to the Celtics, but the series went the full 7 games.

questions.text: The 2008 Celtics broke a record previously held by the 2005 Detroit Pistons and the 1994 New York Knicks, for the most games played in the season's playoffs. How many games did Boston play?
questions.explanation:
26.

	Just 2 games short of a full length postseason of 28. They played 7 games against the Hawks in the 1st round, 7 games against the Cavaliers in the 2nd round, 6 games against the Pistons in the Conference Finals, and 6 games against the Lakers in the finals.

questions.text: In game 6 of the 2008 finals, Ray Allen of the Celtics tied a record for the most 3-pointers made in a final's game. How many did he make?
questions.explanation:
7.

	He also set a record for the most 3-pointers in a final series. He broke the record for the most threes in a final's game in 2010 in game 2, when the two teams met again in the finals, making nine 3-pointers.

questions.text: The Lakers and the Spurs met in the Western Conference Finals. Which two teams did they eliminate in the Conference semi-finals?
questions.explanation:
Jazz and Hornets.

	The Spurs eliminated the Hornets in a physical 7-game series,while the Lakers beat Utah Jazz led by Deron Williams and Carlos Boozer in 6 games.

questions.text: Which team did the Hornets eliminate in the first round of the playoffs in 5 games?
questions.explanation:
Mavericks.

	The Hornets were eliminated in the second round in 7 games by the San Antonio Spurs.

questions.text: In Game 4 of the finals, the Celtics came back from a 24-point deficit in the second quarter to win the game. That was the largest comeback in NBA Finals history since when?
questions.explanation:
1971.

	The record was set by the 1971 Milwaukee Bucks, who swept the Baltimore Bullets in the 1971 Finals.
